Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2023-24 (Graduate Student)

Appeared in 18 games this season for the Golden Eagles...Averaged 2.3 ppg and 8.9 mpg...Scored a season-high six points on 12/18/23 at Kansas State...Pulled down a season-high seven rebounds on 11/9/23 versus Friends.

2022-23 (Senior)

Rodrigues put up career-high numbers last year in her first season with the Golden Eagles as she averaged 5.1 points per game and 3.4 rebounds...Rodrigues tallied a career-high 16 points against Oklahoma and grabbed a career-high 13 rebounds versus Little Rock.

2021-22 (Junior at Oklahoma State)

Appeared in 18 contests ... Registered 32 rebounds, eight blocks and four steals.

2020-21 (Sophomore at Oklahoma State)

Saw her sophomore campaign limited due to injury ... Played in OSU’s contest against Oral Roberts ... Played seven minutes scoring three points and grabbing one rebound

2019-20 (Freshman at Oklahoma State)

Played in 25 games during her rookie campaign, making four starts ... Started the season opener, scoring eight points and grabbing five boards against Idaho ... Finished with five rebounds against Lamar ... Scored five points to go with four rebounds at Tulsa ... Grabbed six rebounds in OSU’s contest against Oregon ... Finished with 10 rebounds, two blocks and seven rebounds against UT Arlington ... Pulled down seven rebounds against Oral Roberts.

HIGH SCHOOL

Competed for a spot on the Brazilian squad at the 2021 FIBA Women’s AmeriCup ... For Colégio Integrado de Guarulhos, averaged 20.0 points and 15.0 rebounds per game ... Also averaged 6.0 assists, 2.1 steals and 4.0 blocks per outing ... She earned MVP honors at the 2014 Federação Paulista, the 2015 Sul Americano Clubes and the Seleção Paulistas ... Has competed for Brazil in multiple events, including the 2016 FIBA U17 Women's World Championship in Spain ... Was also on the Brazilian squads at the 2015 FIBA Americas U16 Championship and the 2014 South American U15 Championship

PERSONAL

Daughter of Jennifer and Mark Curtis ... Chose ORU "because Coach Musick was the coach I felt most comfortable with based on her interviews" .… Expected to major in Psychology and minor in Sociology.
